CustomField.description: 31.10.2016 - Garth James (Salesforce) - Created. This field will be used to create the 'suffix' for the username when it us auto-provisioned for SSO. The suffix, in this case, is everything following on from the '@' sign. So, if the user's email address was 'dead.pool@marvel.com', the provisioner would take 'dead.pool@' and and attach the contents of this field to the rest of the string to create a user login.
CustomField.inlineHelpText: Used to create the 'suffix' for SSO username. The suffix is everything following on from the '@' sign. If the user's email address was 'dead.pool@marvel.com', the provisioner would take 'dead.pool@' and attach this field to create the login.
CustomField.label: Login Domain Suffix
